metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3696 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
nmevent.c in the Novell GroupWise protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidginbefore 2.10.10 allows remote servers to cause a denial of service(application crash) via a crafted server message that triggers a largememory allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2').
